com.yubico.client.v2

Class YubicoClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yubico.client.v2.YubicoClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    YubicoClientImpl

    public abstract class YubicoClient
extends Object
    Base class for doing YubiKey validations using version 2 of the validation protocol.

    • Method Detail

      • verify

        public abstract VerificationResponse verify(String otp)
                                     throws YubicoVerificationException,
                                            YubicoValidationFailure
        Validate an OTP using a webservice call to one or more ykval validation servers.
        Parameters:
        otp - YubiKey OTP
        Returns:
        result of the webservice validation operation
        Throws:
        YubicoVerificationException - for validation errors, like unreachable servers
        YubicoValidationFailure - for validation failures, like non matching OTPs in request and response
        IllegalArgumentException - for arguments that are not correctly formatted OTP strings.

      • getClientId

        public Integer getClientId()
        Get the ykval client identifier used to identify the application.
        Returns:
        ykval client identifier
        See Also:
        setClientId(Integer)

      • setClientId

        public void setClientId(Integer clientId)
        Set the ykval client identifier, used to identify the client application to the validation servers. Such validation is only required for non-https-v2.0 validation queries, where the clientId tells the server what API key (shared secret) to use to validate requests and sign responses. You can get a clientId and API key for the YubiCloud validation service at https://upgrade.yubico.com/getapikey/
        Parameters:
        clientId - ykval client identifier

      • setKey

        public void setKey(String key)
        Set api key to be used for signing requests
        Parameters:
        key - ykval client key
        See Also:
        setClientId(Integer)

      • getKey

        public String getKey()
        Get the api key that is used for signing requests
        Returns:
        ykval client key
        See Also:
        setClientId(Integer)

      • setSync

        public void setSync(Integer sync)
        Set the sync percentage required for a successful auth. Default is to let the server decide.
        Parameters:
        sync - percentage or strings 'secure' or 'fast'

      • getWsapiUrls

        public String[] getWsapiUrls()
        Get the list of URLs that will be used for validating OTPs.
        Returns:
        list of base URLs

      • setWsapiUrls

        public void setWsapiUrls(String[] wsapi)
        Configure what URLs to use for validating OTPs. These URLs will have all the necessary parameters appended to them. Example : {"https://api.yubico.com/wsapi/2.0/verify"}
        Parameters:
        wsapi - list of base URLs

      • warnIfDeprecatedUrl

        protected void warnIfDeprecatedUrl(String url)

      • setUserAgent

        public void setUserAgent(String userAgent)
        Set user agent to be used in request to validation server
        Parameters:
        userAgent - the user agent used in requests

      • getClient

        public static YubicoClient getClient(Integer clientId,
                                     String key)
        Instantiate a YubicoClient object.
        Parameters:
        clientId - Retrieved from https://upgrade.yubico.com/getapikey
        Returns:
        client that can be used to validate YubiKey OTPs

      • getPublicId

        public static String getPublicId(String otp)
        Extract the public ID of a YubiKey from an OTP it generated.
        Parameters:
        otp - The OTP to extract ID from, in modhex format.
        Returns:
        string Public ID of YubiKey that generated otp. Between 0 and 12 lower-case characters.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for arguments that are null or too short to be valid OTP strings.

      • isValidOTPFormat

        public static boolean isValidOTPFormat(String otp)
        Determines whether a given OTP is of the correct length and only contains printable characters, as per the recommendation.
        Parameters:
        otp - The OTP to validate
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if it's valid; false otherwise
